change.item: Batch update to change repository name, subject links, preferred citation, and user restrictions.

did.abstract: Jane Fox taught modern dance at IU from 1927-1965. Her papers include correspondence, research notes, papers and course materials and some publications by others on dance.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jane Fox was born on November 30, 1899 in Clay County, Kentucky. She attended school at the University of Missouri, transferred to the American College of Physical Education in Chicago, and finished her undergraduate degree at Columbia University in New York in 1927. In 1934 she earned her Master's degree in education from Indiana University. She was hired as an instructor in the IU Physical Education Department in 1927, and was promoted to an assistant professor in 1933 and as an associate professor in 1951. During her tenure at IU, Fox taught natural and modern dance as well as theory and technique courses for the teacher training program. Fox choreographed the productions of Parsifal and The Book of Ruth for IU's School of Music. She also established a modern dance workshop for the IU campus. Publications included "Let's Go Modern," "Problems in Dance Production," and "Together We Dance." Fox retired in 1965 and passed away on February 16, 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Jane Fox papers are arranged into one series of Subject files. Included in this small series is an article written by Fox ("Together We Dance") as well as several other papers written during the course of her career, some correspondence, two folders of research notes for her class on the history and theory of dance and other research activities, and a few assorted publications by other writers related to dance.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional publications and research materials may be accessed in IUScholarworks
Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have not transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Jane Fox papers, Collection C554, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Transferred from the School of Public Health to the University Archives, July 2013

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Some fragmentary notes of unknown origin were destroyed.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Meg Knapke and Phil Bantin.
